Hi, I'm Scott!

An Engineer with a Passion in Robotics and Autonomous Systems

University of California, Berkeley - M.Eng M.E. '20

About Me

I am a recent Master’s graduate from the University of California, Berkeley in which I studied Mechanical Engineering and focused on the concentration of Robotics and Controls. I performed my Master’s thesis under the supervision of Dr. Koushil Sreenath on Jumping with the MIT Mini Cheetah through an obstacle. Previously I worked as an R&D Engineer at Air Techniques in their dental imaging department which gathered experience with design verification, prototyping, and product improvements.

Currently, in my free time, I continue to work towards finishing personal projects and advancing my previous algorithm which was developed for my Master’s thesis. I am very passionate about continuing my learning and further refining my skill set.

Forward Jumping with a Quadrupedal Robot
Development of a novel forward jumping optimization to perform jumps over obstacles with quadruped robots.
Contact-Force Based Control for a Bipedal Robot, Cassie
Develop a balancing controller to stabilize a bipedal robot with additional perturbations.
State Estimator for a Vehicle
A Unscented Kalman Filter approach to state estimation given sensor data from an IMU and GPS.
Falcon 9 Model Predictive Controls
Model Predictive Controller for Taking off and Landing of a SpaceX Falcon 9 Rocket.
Astrophotography x 3D Printing
Adapter developed to attach a GoPro and iPhone 8 Plus to a telescope for photographing planets and moons.
Modeling the Solar System via Kepler's Laws
Modeling the orbit of planets and moons in our solar system using two different methods.
Futuristic Clock from the Odd Couple (1970s)
Recreating one of the most unique clock designs to ever be displayed on television.
Workbench with Additional Storage
Workbench to stay organized and provide a great place to work on hardware-based projects.
Sudoku Solvers
Solver for Classic, Anti-King, Anti-Queen, and Anti-Knight Sudoku puzzles.
Portable A/C and Beverage Cooler
Design of a portable beverage cooler and A/C unit which uses ice-water to cool off a small enclosed environment.
Wheelchair Mobility Improvement
Ease wheelchair users by altering how a wheelchair is operated.
Multipurpose Digital Scale
A scale designed to measure both weight and thrust with data acquisition.
